intro: Stenogyne vagans, commonly known as the Hawaiian violet, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal and lowland forests. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to survive.
